alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Santa Cruz, southeastern San Mateo and west central Santa Clara Counties through 130 AM PST... At 1259 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms 9 miles southwest of Boulder Creek, or 14 miles northwest of Santa Cruz, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scotts Valley, Boulder Creek, Felton, Ben Lomond and Lexington Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains
